questions.question_text: What differentiates the Cisco OfficeExtend AP mode from the Cisco FlexConnect AP mode?

choices.D: OfficeExtend mode requires indoor APs with internal antennas, and indoor and outdoor APs use FlexConnect mode.
choices.A: FlexConnect allows a personal SSID to be configured on the AP, and personal SSIDs are not supported with OfficeExtend.
choices.B: OfficeExtend does not support DTLS tunneling of traffic to the WLC, and FlexConnect tunnels traffic to the WLC with DTLS.
choices.C: FlexConnect must be deployed behind a router that NATs the client traffic, and OfficeExtend uses public IP sources.

discussion.content: damn, 5 months of studying and never heard of this, nice one cisco you almost got me

Selected Answer: D
A wrong : All OfficeExtend access points should be in the same access point group, and that group should contain no more than 15 WLANs. A controller with OfficeExtend access points in an access point group publishes only up to 15 WLANs to each connected OfficeExtend access point because it reserves one WLAN for the personal SSID.

B wrong: Datagram Transport Layer Security (DTLS) encryption between the access point and the controller ensures that all communications have the highest level of security. DTLS is permanently enabled on the Cisco OEAP. You cannot disable DTLS on this access point.

C worng: Cisco OEAPs are designed to work behind a router or other gateway device that is using network address translation (NAT).

D correct: The OfficeExtend AP feature is supported on all internal antenna AP models.

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/wireless/controller/8-1/configuration-guide/b_cg81/configuring_officeextend_access_points.html

The Cisco OfficeExtend Access Point (OEAP) mode is designed specifically to extend the corporate network to remote workers at home or in small branch offices. One of its key features is that it supports a secure Datagram Transport Layer Security (DTLS) tunnel back to the Wireless LAN Controller (WLC), allowing both corporate and personal SSIDs to be configured. Personal SSID allows remote employees' personal traffic to be segmented from corporate traffic.

Cisco FlexConnect AP mode, formerly known as H-REAP, allows access points to switch network traffic locally and only send control traffic to the controller. This mode is used primarily for branch office and remote deployments where it might not be ideal to tunnel all client traffic back to the WLC.

questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. A network engineer is configuring a WLAN to connect with the 172.16.10.0/24 network on VLAN 20. The engineer wants to limit the number of devices that connect to the WLAN on the USERWL SSID to 125. Which configuration must the engineer perform on the WLC?

choices.D: In the Advanced configuration, set the DTIM value to 125.
choices.B: In the WLAN configuration, set the Maximum Allowed Clients value to 125.
choices.A: In the Controller IPv6 configuration, set the Throttle value to 125.
choices.C: In the Management Software activation configuration, set the Clients value to 125.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C is correct

Selected Answer: C
C. channel-group 1 mode active

questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. An LACP EtherChannel between two directly connected switches is in the configuration process. Which command must be configured on switch SW2s Gi0/1-2 interfaces to establish the channel to SW1?

//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. An administrator must connect SW_1 and the printer to the network. SW_2 requires DTP to be used for the connection to SW_1. The printer is configured as an access port with VLAN 5. Which set of commands completes the connectivity?

choices.B:
switchport mode trunk
switchport trunk pruning vlan add 5
choices.A:
switchport mode dynamic auto
switchport private-vlan association host 5
choices.D:
switchport mode dynamic auto
switchport trunk encapsulation negotiate
choices.C:
switchport mode dynamic desirable
switchport trunk allowed vlan add 5

discussion.content:
* SW2 Et0/2 is configured with dynamic auto mode. Interface (Et0/2) of SW1 should be configured in either trunk or dynamic desirable mode to establish
a trunk link. 

* The "Pruning VLAN" command is the opposite of the "allowed VLAN" command, it excludes certain VLANs from being allowed on a trunk link.

Option A is incorrect, mode can't be auto
Option B is incorrect, mode is correct, but "switchport allowed vlan add 5" command should be used instead.
Option C is correct
option D is incorrect. The mode must be set to dynamic desirable or trunk

Selected Answer: C
C is correct

Selected Answer: C
C is correct
